data.name: Tangela
data.flavorText: It tangles any moving thing with its vines. Their subtle shaking is ticklish if you get ensnared.

data.name: Tangrowth
data.flavorText: Its vines grow so profusely that, in the warm season, you can't even see its eyes.

data.name: Scyther
data.flavorText: While young, they live together deep in the mountains, training themselves in how to fight with their scythes and move at high speeds.

data.name: Pinsir
data.flavorText: One solid blow from its horns is enough to split apart a large tree. Its greatest rival in Alola is Vikavolt.

data.name: Chikorita
data.flavorText: It uses the leaf on its head to determine the temperature and humidity. It loves to sunbathe.

data.name: Chikorita
data.flavorText: It uses the leaf on its head to determine the temperature and humidity. It loves to sunbathe.

data.name: Bayleef
data.flavorText: The buds that ring its neck give off a spicy aroma that perks people up.

data.name: Meganium
data.flavorText: Meganium's breath has the power to revive dead grass and plants. It can make them healthy again.

data.name: Spinarak
data.flavorText: Some fishermen weave its sturdy thread into nets to catch fish Pokémon.

data.name: Ariados
data.flavorText: It spins thread from both its rear and its mouth. Then it wraps its prey up in thread and sips their bodily fluids at its leisure.

data.name: Hoppip
data.flavorText: It drifts on winds. It is said that when Hoppip gather in fields and mountains, spring is on the way.

data.name: Hoppip
data.flavorText: It drifts on winds. It is said that when Hoppip gather in fields and mountains, spring is on the way.

data.name: Skiploom
data.flavorText: It spreads its petals to absorb sunlight. It also floats in the air to get closer to the sun.

data.name: Jumpluff
data.flavorText: Even in the fiercest wind, it can control its fluff to make its way to any place in the world it wants.

data.name: Pineco
data.flavorText: It looks just like a pinecone. Its shell protects it from bird Pokémon that peck it by mistake.

data.name: Shuckle
data.flavorText: It stores berries inside its shell. To avoid attacks, it hides beneath rocks and remains completely still.

data.name: Heracross
data.flavorText: With its Herculean powers, it can easily throw around an object that is 100 times its own weight.

data.name: Celebi ◇
data.flavorText: It has the power to travel across time, but it is said to appear only in peaceful times.

data.name: Treecko
data.flavorText: Small hooks on the bottom of its feet catch on walls and ceilings. That is how it can hang from above.

data.name: Grovyle
data.flavorText: It lives in dense jungles. While closing in on its prey, it leaps from branch to branch.

data.name: Wurmple
data.flavorText: It lives among the tall grass and in forests. It repels attacks by raising up the spikes on its rear.

data.name: Wurmple
data.flavorText: It lives among the tall grass and in forests. It repels attacks by raising up the spikes on its rear.

data.name: Silcoon
data.flavorText: It drinks dew that collects on its silk and waits for evolution. Its hard cocoon repels attacks.

data.name: Beautifly
data.flavorText: It has an aggressive nature. It stabs prey with its long, narrow mouth to drain the prey's fluids.

data.name: Cascoon
data.flavorText: It never forgets any attack it endured while in the cocoon. After evolution, it seeks payback.

data.name: Dustox
data.flavorText: It violently flutters its wings to scatter toxic dust when attacked. It becomes active after sunset.

data.name: Nincada
data.flavorText: It can sometimes live underground for more than 10 years. It absorbs nutrients from the roots of trees.

data.name: Ninjask
data.flavorText: Because it moves so quickly, it sometimes becomes unseeable. It congregates around tree sap.

data.name: Combee
data.flavorText: It collects and delivers honey to its colony. At night, they cluster to form a beehive and sleep.

data.name: Vespiquen
data.flavorText: Its abdomen is a honeycomb for grubs. It raises its grubs on honey collected by Combee.

data.name: Shaymin
data.flavorText: The blooming of Gracidea flowers confers the power of flight upon it. Feelings of gratitude are the message it delivers.

data.name: Skiddo
data.flavorText: If it has sunshine and water, it doesn't need to eat, because it can generate energy from the leaves on its back.

data.name: Gogoat
data.flavorText: They inhabit mountainous regions. The leader of the herd is decided by a battle of clashing horns.

data.name: Tapu Bulu
data.flavorText: The guardian deity of Ula'ula is a lazy Pokémon. It commands plants to immobilize its foes and then deals them a savage blow with its horns.

data.name: Moltres
data.flavorText: One of the legendary bird Pokémon. It is said that its appearance indicates the coming of spring.

data.name: Cyndaquil
data.flavorText: It has a timid nature. If it is startled, the flames on its back burn more vigorously.

data.name: Cyndaquil
data.flavorText: It has a timid nature. If it is startled, the flames on its back burn more vigorously.

data.name: Quilava
data.flavorText: Be careful if it turns its back during battle. It means that it will attack with the fire on its back.

data.name: Typhlosion
data.flavorText: It has a secret, devastating move. It rubs its blazing fur together to cause huge explosions.

data.name: Slugma
data.flavorText: Its body is made of magma. If it doesn't keep moving, its body will cool and harden.

data.name: Houndour
data.flavorText: To corner prey, they check each other's location using barks that only they can understand.

data.name: Houndoom
data.flavorText: The flames it breathes when angry contain toxins. If they cause a burn, it will hurt forever.

data.name: Entei
data.flavorText: It is said that when it roars, a volcano erupts somewhere around the globe.

data.name: Heatran
data.flavorText: Boiling blood, like magma, circulates through its body. It makes its dwelling place in volcanic caves.

data.name: Victini
data.flavorText: When it shares the infinite energy it creates, that being's entire body will be overflowing with power.

data.name: Litleo
data.flavorText: They set off on their own from their pride and live by themselves to become stronger. These hot-blooded Pokémon are quick to fight.

data.name: Pyroar
data.flavorText: With fiery breath of more than 10,000 degrees Fahrenheit, they viciously threaten any challenger. The females protect the pride's cubs.

data.name: Alolan Vulpix
data.flavorText: In hot weather, this Pokémon makes ice shards with its six tails and sprays them around to cool itself off.

data.name: Slowpoke
data.flavorText: Alolan home cooking involves drying Slowpoke tails and then simmering them into a salty stew.

data.name: Slowking
data.flavorText: This Pokémon is so famed for its intellect that a proverb still persists in some regions: "When in doubt, ask Slowking."

data.name: Lapras
data.flavorText: These Pokémon were once near extinction due to poaching. Following protective regulations, there is now an overabundance of them.

data.name: Delibird
data.flavorText: It has a generous habit of sharing its food with people and Pokémon, so it's always scrounging around for more food.

data.name: Mantine
data.flavorText: While elegantly swimming in the sea, it ignores Remoraid that cling to its fins seeking food scraps.

data.name: Suicune
data.flavorText: Said to be the embodiment of north winds, it can instantly purify filthy, murky water.

data.name: Cubchoo
data.flavorText: Their snot is a barometer of health. When healthy, their snot is sticky and the power of their ice moves increases.

data.name: Beartic
data.flavorText: It freezes its breath to create fangs and claws of ice to fight with. Cold northern areas are its habitat.

data.name: White Kyurem
data.flavorText: It generates a powerful, freezing energy inside itself, but its body became frozen when the energy leaked out.

data.name: Popplio
data.flavorText: This Pokémon snorts body fluids from its nose, blowing balloons to smash into its foes. It's famous for being a hard worker.

data.name: Popplio
data.flavorText: This Pokémon can control water bubbles. It practice diligently so it can learn to make big bubbles.

data.name: Brionne
data.flavorText: It cares deeply for its companions. When its Trainer is feeling down, it performs a cheery dance to try and help.

data.name: Primarina
data.flavorText: Its singing voice is its chief weapon in battle. This Pokémon's Trainer must prioritize the daily maintenance of its throat at all costs.

data.name: Mareanie
data.flavorText: It's found crawling on beaches and seafloors. The coral that grows on Corsola's head is as good as a five-star banquet to this Pokémon.

data.name: Toxapex
data.flavorText: Those attacked by Toxapex's poison will suffer intense pain for three days and three nights. Post-recovery, there will be some aftereffects.

data.name: Bruxish
data.flavorText: It stuns its prey with psychokinesis and then grinds them to mush with its strong teeth. Even Shellder's shell is no match for it.

data.name: Electabuzz
data.flavorText: Electricity leaks from it in amounts far greater than the amount of electricity it eats.

data.name: Electivire
data.flavorText: When it gets excited, it thumps its chest. With every thud, thunder roars and electric sparks shower all around.

data.name: Chinchou
data.flavorText: It lives in the depths beyond the reach of sunlight. It flashes lights on its antennae to communicate with others of its kind.

data.name: Lanturn
data.flavorText: This Pokémon flashes a bright light that blinds its prey. This creates an opening for it to deliver an electrical attack.

data.name: Mareep
data.flavorText: It stores lots of air in its soft fur, allowing it to stay cool in summer and warm in winter.

data.name: Mareep
data.flavorText: It stores lots of air in its soft fur, allowing it to stay cool in summer and warm in winter.

data.name: Flaaffy
data.flavorText: If its coat becomes fully charged with electricity, its tail lights up. It fires hair that zaps on impact.

data.name: Ampharos
data.flavorText: The tail's tip shines brightly and can be seen from far away. It acts as a beacon for lost people.

data.name: Raikou
data.flavorText: This rough Pokémon stores energy inside its body, then sweeps across the land, shooting off electricity.

data.name: Pachirisu
data.flavorText: A pair may be seen rubbing their cheek pouches together in an effort to share stored electricity.

data.name: Blitzle
data.flavorText: Its mane shines when it discharges electricity. They use the frequency and rhythm of these flashes to communicate.

data.name: Zebstrika
data.flavorText: They have lightning-like movements. When Zebstrika run at full speed, the sound of thunder reverberates.

data.name: Stunfisk
data.flavorText: It conceals itself in the mud of the seashore. Then it waits. When prey touch it, it delivers a jolt of electricity.

data.name: Dedenne
data.flavorText: It uses its tail to absorb electricity from power plants or from outlets in houses, and then it fires the electricity from its whiskers.

data.name: Tapu Koko
data.flavorText: It confuses its enemies by flying too quickly for the eye to follow. It has a hair-trigger temper but forgets what made it angry an instant later.

data.name: Natu
data.flavorText: It usually forages for food on the ground bu may, on rare occasions, hop onto branches to peck at shoots.

data.name: Xatu
data.flavorText: They say that it stays still and quiet because it is seeing both the past and future at the same time.

data.name: Espeon
data.flavorText: It unleashes psychic power from the orb on its forehead. When its power is exhausted, the orb grows dull and dark.

data.name: Unown
data.flavorText: Shaped like ancient writing, it is a huge mystery whether language or Unown came first.

data.name: Unown
data.flavorText: Shaped like ancient writing, it is a huge mystery whether language or Unown came first.

data.name: Unown
data.flavorText: Shaped like ancient writing, it is a huge mystery whether language or Unown came first.

data.name: Wobbuffet
data.flavorText: To keep its pitch-black tail hidden, it live quietly in the darkness. It is never first to attack.

data.name: Girafarig
data.flavorText: Its tail has a small brain of its own. Beware! If you get close, it may react to your scent by biting.

data.name: Shedinja
data.flavorText: A most peculiar Pokémon that somehow appears in a Poké Ball when a Nincada evolves.

data.name: Sableye
data.flavorText: This Pokémon is feared. When its gemstone eyes begin to glow with a sinister shine, it's believed that Sableye will steal people's spirits away.

data.name: Giratina
data.flavorText: It was banished for its violence. It silently gazed upon the old world from the Distortion World.

data.name: Yamask
data.flavorText: Each of them carries a mask that used to be its face when it was human. Sometimes they look at it and cry.

data.name: Cofagrigus
data.flavorText: Grave robbers who mistake them for real coffins and get too close end up trapped inside their bodies.

data.name: Litwick
data.flavorText: Litwick shines a light that absorbs the life energy of people and Pokémon, which becomes the fuel that it burns.

data.name: Lampent
data.flavorText: It arrives near the moment of death and steals spirit from the body.

data.name: Chandelure
data.flavorText: The spirits burned up in its ominous flame lose their way and wander this world forever.

data.name: Meloetta
data.flavorText: Its melodies are sung with a special vocalization method that can control the feels of those who hear it.

data.name: Mareanie
data.flavorText: It plunges the poison spike on its head into its prey. When the prey has weakened, Mareanie deals the finishing blow with its 10 tentacles.

data.name: Nihilego
data.flavorText: One of the Ultra Beasts, it's unclear whether or not this Pokémon is sentient, but sometimes it can be observed behaving like a young girl.

data.name: Poipole
data.flavorText: This Ultra Beast is well enough liked to be chosen as a first partner in its own world.

data.name: Naganadel
data.flavorText: It stores hundreds of liters of poisonous liquid inside its body. It is one of the organisms known as UBs.

data.name: Onix
data.flavorText: It usually lives underground. It searches for food while boring its way through the ground at 50 miles per hour.

data.name: Sudowoodo
data.flavorText: Apparently, the larger the green parts of this Pokémon, the more collectors value it. It's a particular favorite among elderly people.

data.name: Phanpy
data.flavorText: It is strong despite its compact size. It can easily pick up and carry an adult human on its back.

data.name: Donphan
data.flavorText: The longer and bigger its tusks, the higher its rank in its herd. The tusks take long to grow.

data.name: Hitmontop
data.flavorText: If you are enchanted by its smooth, dance-like kicks, you may get a closer experience with one than you'd like.

data.name: Larvitar
data.flavorText: Born deep underground, it comes aboveground and becomes a pupa once it has finished eating the surrounding soil.

data.name: Larvitar
data.flavorText: Born deep underground, it comes aboveground and becomes a pupa once it has finished eating the surrounding soil.

data.name: Pupitar
data.flavorText: Its shell is as hard as sheet rock, and it is also very strong. Its thrashing can topple a mountain.

data.name: Carbink
data.flavorText: Although this Pokémon is not especially rare, its glittering, jewel-draped body draws attention from people.

data.name: Alolan Meowth
data.flavorText: When its delicate pride is wounded, or when the gold coin on its forehead is dirtied, it flies into a hysterical rage.

data.name: Alolan Persian
data.flavorText: It looks down on everyone other than itself. Its preferred tactics are sucker punches and blindside attacks.

data.name: Umbreon
data.flavorText: With its black fur, it blends into the darkness. It bides its time, and when prey appears, this Pokémon goes for its threat, and then eats it.

data.name: Alolan Diglett
data.flavorText: Its golden hairs function as sensors. It pokes them out of its burrow to monitor its surroundings.

data.name: Alolan Dugtrio
data.flavorText: These Pokémon are cherished in the Alola region, where they are thought to be feminine deities of the land incarnate.

data.name: Forretress
data.flavorText: It remains immovably rooted to its tree. It scatters piece of its hard shell to drive its enemies away.

data.name: Steelix
data.flavorText: It chews its way through boulders with its sturdy jaws. Its eyes can see in the darkness underground.

data.name: Scizor
data.flavorText: Once it has identified an enemy, this Pokémon smashes it mercilessly with pincers hard as steel.

data.name: Dialga
data.flavorText: It has the power to control time. It appears in Sinnoh-region myths as an ancient deity.

data.name: Durant
data.flavorText: They attack in groups, covering themselves in steel armor to protect themselves from Heatmor.

data.name: Cobalion
data.flavorText: It has a body and heart of steel. It worked with its allies to punish people when they hurt Pokémon.

data.name: Magearna
data.flavorText: Its mechanized body is merely a vessel. Its true self is its Soul-Heart, an artificial soul.

data.name: Jigglypuff
data.flavorText: Jigglypuff posses a vocal range that exceeds 12 octaves, but each individual's singing skill depends on its own effort.

data.name: Wigglytuff
data.flavorText: As it inhales, it expands…and expands…and expands. Wigglytuff compete to see which one can inflate itself the most.

data.name: Marill
data.flavorText: The tip of its tail is filled with oil that is lighter than water, so it acts as a float.

data.name: Azumarill
data.flavorText: The bubble-like pattern on its stomach helps it camouflage itself when it's in the water.

data.name: Snubbull
data.flavorText: Its growls make its opponents uneasy. This laid-back Pokémon tends to sleep half the day.

data.name: Granbull
data.flavorText: More timid than Snubbull, this Pokémon is doted on by young people amused at the contrast between its looks and its attitude.

data.name: Ralts
data.flavorText: It is highly attuned to the emotions of people and Pokémon. It hides if it senses hostility.

data.name: Kirlia
data.flavorText: It has a psychic power that enabled it to distort the space around it and see into the future.

data.name: Gardevoir
data.flavorText: It has the power to predict the future. Its power peaks when it is protecting its Trainer.

data.name: Dedenne
data.flavorText: It uses its tail to absorb electricity from power plants or from outlets in houses, and then it fires the electricity from its whiskers.

data.name: Carbink
data.flavorText: Although this Pokémon is not especially rare, its glittering, jewel-draped body draws attention from people.

data.name: Xerneas ◇
data.flavorText: When the horns on its head shine in seven colors, it is said to be sharing everlasting life.

data.name: Cutiefly
data.flavorText: Myriads of Cutiefly flutter above the heads of people who have auras resembling those of flowers.

data.name: Ribombee
data.flavorText: Some of Ribombee's pollen puffs are highly nutritious. They are sometimes sold as supplements.

data.name: Morelull
data.flavorText: As it drowses the day away, it nourishes itself by sucking from tree roots. It wakens at the fall of night, wandering off in search of a new tree.

data.name: Shiinotic
data.flavorText: It emits flickering spores that cause drowsiness. When its prey succumb to sleep, this Pokémon feeds on them by sucking in their energy.

data.name: Tapu Lele
data.flavorText: As it flutters about, it scatters its strangely glowing scales. Touching them is said to restore good health on the spot.

data.name: Tapu Fini
data.flavorText: The guardian deity of Poni, it can control water. People say it can create pure water that will wash away any uncleanness.

data.name: Chansey
data.flavorText: Not only are these Pokémon fast runners, they're also few in number, so anyone who finds one must be lucky indeed.

data.name: Blissey
data.flavorText: Its fluffy fur coat acts as a sensor, enabling it to read the feelings of people and Pokémon.

data.name: Ditto ◇
data.flavorText: With its astonishing capacity for metamorphosis, it can get along with anything. It does not get along well with its fellow Ditto.

data.name: Eevee
data.flavorText: Current studies show it can evolve into an incredible eight different species of Pokémon.

data.name: Stantler
data.flavorText: The curved antlers change the flow of air to create a strange space where reality is distorted.

data.name: Smeargle
data.flavorText: It draws symbols all over the place to mark its territory. In towns with many Smeargle, the walls are covered in graffiti.

data.name: Miltank
data.flavorText: Most people raise it for its milk, but it's quite tough and strong, so it's also well suited for battle.

data.name: Ho-Oh
data.flavorText: It will reveal itself before a pure-hearted Trainer by shining its bright, rainbow-colored wings.

data.name: Kecleon
data.flavorText: It changes its shading to match its surroundings so it can sneak up on prey. Only its belly patterns stay fixed.

data.name: Kecleon
data.flavorText: It changes its shading to match its surroundings so it can sneak up on prey. Only its belly patterns stay fixed.

data.name: Pikipek
data.flavorText: This Pokémon feeds on berries, whose leftover seeds become the ammunition for attacks it fires off from its mouth.

data.name: Pikipek
data.flavorText: This Pokémon feeds on berries, whose leftover seeds become the ammunition for attacks it fires off from its mouth.

data.name: Trumbeak
data.flavorText: By bending its beak, it can produce a variety of calls and brand itself a noisy nuisance for its neighbors.

data.name: Toucannon
data.flavorText: Within its beak, its internal gas ignites, explosively launching seeds with enough power to pulverize boulders.
